geovctrs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Format and print geovctrs

Source: R/geo-print.R
geo_print.Rd

Format and prints the geo_summary() of an geovctr.

geo_print(x, ..., short = FALSE, col = TRUE)

geo_format(x, ..., short = FALSE, col = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A geometry-like object, or one that can be coerced to a geometry-like object using as_geovctr().
...

Passed to geo_format()
short

Use to print a shorter summary
col

Use to colourize the output

Examples

geo_format(head(geo_nc))
#> [1] "MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-81.47276 36.23436)…+26"
#> [2] "MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-81.23989 36.36536)…+25"
#> [3] "MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-80.45634 36.24256)…+27"
#> [4] "MULTIPOLYGON[3] (-76.00897 36.31960)…+37"
#> [5] "MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-77.21767 36.24098)…+33"
#> [6] "MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-76.74506 36.23392)…+21"
geo_print(head(geo_nc))
#> <geo_wkb[6]>
#> [1] MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-81.47276 36.23436)…+26
#> [2] MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-81.23989 36.36536)…+25
#> [3] MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-80.45634 36.24256)…+27
#> [4] MULTIPOLYGON[3] (-76.00897 36.31960)…+37
#> [5] MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-77.21767 36.24098)…+33
#> [6] MULTIPOLYGON[1] (-76.74506 36.23392)…+21
